top: Amazon inc, the e-commerce giant has said nearly 20,000 of its workforce in the United States have tested positive for COVID-19 in a span of over six months.

In its company blog on Thursday, Amazon said it examined data of 1.37 million workers at Amazon and Whole Foods Market across the US, from March 1 to September 19 and opined that the infection rate of its employees was well below the statistics of the US population at large.
Still, some lawmakers called for Amazon to release more granular data about Covid-19 outbreaks in its facilities.
